name: k6-performance-testing
description: Projeto de testes de performance com k6 demonstrando domínio em testes não-funcionais

scripts.test:all: npm run test:load && npm run test:stress && npm run test:spike && npm run test:multi
scripts.test:load:verbose: k6 run --verbose --out html=results/load-test-report.html --out json=results/load-test-results.json --out csv=results/load-test-results.csv scripts/load-tests/load-test.js
scripts.test:stress:verbose: k6 run --verbose --out html=results/stress-test-report.html --out json=results/stress-test-results.json --out csv=results/stress-test-results.csv scripts/stress-tests/stress-test.js
scripts.test:spike:verbose: k6 run --verbose --out html=results/spike-test-report.html --out json=results/spike-test-results.json --out csv=results/spike-test-results.csv scripts/spike-tests/spike-test.js
scripts.test:multi:verbose: k6 run --verbose --out html=results/multi-endpoint-report.html --out json=results/multi-endpoint-results.json --out csv=results/multi-endpoint-results.csv scripts/multi-endpoint-test.js
scripts.setup: mkdir -p results && echo 'Diretório results criado com sucesso'
scripts.help:
echo 'Comandos disponíveis:
- npm run test:load: Teste de carga
- npm run test:stress: Teste de stress
- npm run test:spike: Teste de pico
- npm run test:multi: Teste multi-endpoint
- npm run test:all: Todos os testes
- npm run clean: Limpar resultados'

author: Anthony Coelho <anthonycoelho.dp@hotmail.com>
